result.execSummary:
The defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay mandatory all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Court waived  all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.
Hearing November 22, 2022 at 10:00 a.m. in Branch 2.

No use or possession of alcohol.
No use or possession of any prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
NO CONTACT WITH:  Subway Shop located at 710 North Plankinton Avenue.,  Bradley Symphony Orchestra located at 212 West Wisconsin Avenue, TJ Maxx located at 161 West Wisconsin Avenue., R.M. and H.P., Mayfair Mall, District 3 Police department and officers unless in a professional manner (i.e. defendant reaching out for help).

Actively participate in cognitive behavior therapy.
Complete a psychological or psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aleczander M Watson-Wright

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 2, 3, and 4 and CONSECUTIVE to 22CM1128. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  Court allows for good time credit. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 144 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 144 days time served.  A time served disposition. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1, 2, and 4 and CONSECUTIVE to 22CM1128. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  Court allows for good time credit. 

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1, 2, and 3 and CONSECUTIVE to 22CM1128. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  Court allows for good time credit. 

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, AND 4
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of alcohol. 
- No use or possession of any prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- Actively participate in cognitive behavior therapy.
- Complete a psychological or psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- NO CONTACT with Subway Shop located at 710 North Plankinton Avenue.
- NO CONTACT with Bradley Symphony Orchestra located at 212 West Wisconsin Avenue.
- NO CONTACT with TJ Maxx located at 161 West Wisconsin Avenue.
- NO CONTACT with R.M. and H.P. 
- NO CONTACT with Mayfair Mall.
- NO CONTACT with District 3 Police Department and Officers UNLESS in a professional manner (i.e. defendant reaching out for help).

Court ordered the defendant to pay mandatory all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  20 day appeal rights given.

Court scheduled a restitution hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Aleczander M Watson-Wright.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  State filed Amended Information.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information, waives formal reading, and pleads not guilty on behalf of Mr. Watson-Wright. 

Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, AND 4:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 5 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Sentencing proceeded.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, appeared in person. Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared  by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski; both appear by video.  Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case remains calendared for 7/11/2022 at 8:30am for status and is adjourned to Br. 02.

Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing at 8:30am. Case called at 4:53pm. Due to Court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  

Defendant to have no contact with persons: HP, NL, RS, MH, and AM

Defendant to have no contact with the area within the locations:
1. 310 W. Wisconsin Avenue
2. 710 N. Plankinton Avenue
3. 161 W. Wisconsin Avenue
4. 212 W. Wisconsin Avenue
In the City and County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Court orders defendant turned over to Justice Point for level 5 supervision.  
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No possession of burglarious tools. 
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. As to Misdemeanor Counts 1 and 2 Defense enters pleas of not guilty. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.

Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  Amanda Kirklewski for Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel appears via Zoom. Case scheduled for return on doctor report. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Aleczander M Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
